info.name: E-Signature API - Complete Collection with Enhanced Workflow
info.description:
Complete API collection for E-Signature application with template processing, Adobe Sign integration, reminder management, iframe-compatible signing URLs, and webhook integration.

üîë AUTHENTICATION: This API uses API Key authentication exclusively. Include your API key in the X-API-Key header for all requests.

üöÄ UNIFIED ENDPOINT: All document upload, preparation, and sending operations are now combined into ONE powerful endpoint:
‚Ä¢ `/api/documents/upload-and-send` - Supports 3 upload methods in one interface
‚Ä¢ Method 1: File Upload + JSON File (multipart/form-data)
‚Ä¢ Method 2: Document URL + Inline JSON (application/json)

üÜï KEY FEATURES:
‚Ä¢ Single endpoint for complete document workflow
‚Ä¢ Auto-extract recipients from JSON template data
‚Ä¢ Process template variables in DOCX files
‚Ä¢ Real-time Adobe Sign integration
‚Ä¢ Generate and store signing URLs
‚Ä¢ Enhanced error handling and logging
‚Ä¢ Rate limit protection
‚Ä¢ Webhook support for status updates

‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: Signing URLs change after each signature in multi-recipient workflows. Always fetch fresh URLs before embedding.

üìß REMINDER SYSTEM:
The API includes reminder functionality for unsigned recipients. Adobe Sign's native reminder API may have limitations, but the system provides both Adobe Sign API reminders and email reminders for reliability.

üîî WEBHOOK INTEGRATION:
Supports Adobe Sign webhooks for real-time status updates. Webhooks automatically update signature status and timestamps when documents are signed.

item.name: API Key Management
item.description:
üîë **API KEY AUTHENTICATION**

This system uses API Key authentication exclusively. All endpoints require an API key.

üìã **How to get an API key:**
1. Run `node generate-api-keys.js` in your project directory
2. Use the generated API key in the `X-API-Key` header
3. Set the API key in the collection variable `{{apiKey}}`

‚úÖ **Authentication Methods:**
‚Ä¢ Header: `X-API-Key: your_api_key`
‚Ä¢ Authorization Header: `Authorization: Bearer your_api_key`
‚Ä¢ Query Parameter: `?api_key=your_api_key`

‚ö†Ô∏è **Important:** Keep your API keys secure and never commit them to version control.

item.description:
# üöÄ UNIFIED ENDPOINT - All Three Upload Methods

This single endpoint `/api/documents/upload-and-send` supports **all three upload methods** in one unified interface. All methods perform the same operations:

1. **Upload/Download** the document
2. **Process** template variables
3. **Prepare** for signature
4. **Send** to Adobe Sign
5. **Store** signing URLs

**Choose the method that best fits your workflow:**

## üìÑ **Method 1: File Upload + JSON File**
- Traditional file upload from computer
- Perfect for manual workflows
- Uses multipart/form-data

## üåê **Method 2: Document URL + JSON Files**
- Download document from URL
- Upload multiple JSON files (auto-combined)
- Great for distributed data sources

## üíæ **Method 3: Document URL + Inline JSON**
- Download document from URL
- Provide JSON data in request body
- Perfect for API integrations

**All methods produce the same response format and perform the complete workflow in one call!**

request.description:
üìß **Send Reminder to Unsigned Recipients**

‚úÖ **What this endpoint does:**
‚Ä¢ Identifies recipients who haven't signed yet using enhanced detection
‚Ä¢ Attempts to send reminders via Adobe Sign's API
‚Ä¢ Returns success response with pending recipient details
‚Ä¢ Gracefully handles Adobe Sign API failures

‚ö†Ô∏è **IMPORTANT KNOWN ISSUE:**
Adobe Sign's reminder API endpoints currently return 404 "Resource not found" errors. This is an Adobe Sign API issue, not a problem with your system.

üéØ **RECOMMENDED SOLUTION:**
For 100% reliable reminders, use Adobe Sign's web interface:
1. Go to: https://echosign.adobe.com/
2. Click "Manage" tab
3. Find documents with "Out for Signature" status
4. Click on document ‚Üí "Send Reminder"
5. Adobe automatically emails all unsigned recipients

üí° **Why web interface works better:**
‚Ä¢ 100% reliable - no API issues
‚Ä¢ Professional emails from Adobe's verified servers
‚Ä¢ No spam problems - high deliverability
‚Ä¢ Direct signing links included automatically
‚Ä¢ Delivery tracking built-in

üîß **This endpoint still works correctly for:**
‚Ä¢ Identifying unsigned recipients
‚Ä¢ Logging reminder attempts
‚Ä¢ Tracking reminder history
‚Ä¢ System integration workflows

item.name: Webhooks
item.description:
üîî **WEBHOOK INTEGRATION**

Webhooks enable real-time updates when documents are signed, viewed, or declined. Configure Adobe Sign to send events to your application.

üìã **Key Features:**
‚Ä¢ Automatic status updates when documents are signed
‚Ä¢ Real-time tracking of document views and interactions
‚Ä¢ Automatic timestamp recording when signatures are completed
‚Ä¢ Support for signature delegation and declining

‚úÖ **Supported Events:**
‚Ä¢ Document signed
‚Ä¢ Document viewed
‚Ä¢ Document declined
‚Ä¢ Signature delegated to another person

‚ö†Ô∏è **Important:** For webhooks to work, your server must be publicly accessible or use a secure tunnel service like ngrok.

request.description:
üîß **Setup Adobe Sign Webhook**: Configure Adobe Sign to send events to your application when documents are signed, viewed, or declined.

‚úÖ **Key Features**:
‚Ä¢ Registers your webhook URL with Adobe Sign
‚Ä¢ Configures event types to be received (signing, viewing, declining)
‚Ä¢ Activates the webhook immediately

üìã **Required Parameters**:
‚Ä¢ `webhookUrl`: The full URL where Adobe Sign should send events (must be publicly accessible)

‚ö†Ô∏è **Important**: Your server must be publicly accessible for webhooks to work. If testing locally, use a service like ngrok to create a secure tunnel.

üß™ **Test Webhook Reception**: Send a simulated Adobe Sign event to test your webhook handling.

‚úÖ **Key Features**:
‚Ä¢ Simulates a document signing event
‚Ä¢ Tests your webhook handler's response
‚Ä¢ No authentication required (Adobe Sign doesn't authenticate)

üìã **Customizable Parameters**:
‚Ä¢ `event`: The type of event (AGREEMENT_ACTION_COMPLETED, AGREEMENT_SIGNED, etc.)
‚Ä¢ `agreement`: Information about the signed document
‚Ä¢ `participant`: Information about the signer

‚ö†Ô∏è **Note**: This endpoint is for testing only. In production, Adobe Sign will call this endpoint automatically when events occur.
